subject: Re: [junit] tests do not run after adding another suite to AllTests
msgSnippet: Bill, On the face of it, there s nothing that seems obviously wrong, nor can I think of a common mistake that would lead to that behavior.  There s a couple
messageBody:
Bill,

On the face of it, there's nothing that seems obviously wrong, nor can I
think of a common mistake that would lead to that behavior. There's a
couple ways to drive debugging from here, in order:

1) It looks like you're using ant. Does either suite run from the command
line, or from within an IDE like Eclipse?
2) Can you run the suite in a debugger (say, in Eclipse)?
3) Can you "delta debug" by commenting out lines in the offending suite, and
drive down to a particular problem class?
4) What ant command are you using?

Good luck,

David Saff

On 11/6/06, bill turner <bill.turner@...> wrote:
>
> Running Junit 3.8.
>
> I have an AllTests class that does not run after adding a new suite.
> Here is the top level AllTest code:
>
> <snip>
>
> public static Test suite () throws Exception
> {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("all powerpick tests");
>
> suite.addTest(com.rjmdental.powerpick.types.test.AllTests.suite());
> suite.addTest(com.rjmdental.powerpick.input.test.AllTests.suite());
> //
> suite.addTest(com.rjmdental.powerpick.sequence.test.AllTests.suite());
> return suite;
> }
>
> </snip>
>
> When the last one is uncommented my run changes from:
>
> <snip>
> test_powerpick:
> [junit] Running com.rjmdental.powerpick.test.AllTests
> [junit] Tests run: 58, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.25 sec
> [junit] Testsuite: com.rjmdental.powerpick.test.AllTests
> [junit] Tests run: 58, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.25 sec
> .
> .
> .
> </snip>
>
> to:
>
> <snip>
> test_powerpick:
> [junit] Running com.rjmdental.powerpick.test.AllTests
> </snip>
>
> I have compared the "sequence" AllTest to the "input" AllTest and see
> no significant difference. The sequence AllTest adds only one suite,
> whereas input adds two. I've compared these class specific test
> classes and again see no significant difference. Obviously, I am
> missing something, but I do not know where to look. Any suggestions
> would be greatly appreciated.
>
> TIA,
>
> bill turner
>
>
